lines.text: Ladies and gentlemen, this break in our motion picture is made out of respect for the TV fans in our audience, who are accustomed to constant interruptions in their programs for messages from sponsors. We want all you TV fans to feel at home, and not forget the thrill you get, watching television on your big, 21-inch screens.
Each little Crunchie contains energy, contains pep for your growing youngsters, builds strong legs so that when they're older they can stand the long waits in the unemployment lines.
That's right Sweetie, I'm president of Rita Marlowe Productions, Incorporated, but Miss Marlowe is the titular head.
Of course, the great thing about television is that it lets you see events live as they happen, like old movies from thirty years ago.
George, how come you never tried to kiss me before?
I never could get close enough.
[turns his head to the camera and raises his eyebrows up and down]
Don't tell me you've gone and flipped for Rock?
[Peers at her]
Well, I'll be a writer's subplot. You have.
Don't talk dirty on TV, it's a family medium!
What you need is a drink.
And how!
Maybe two drinks! What'll it be?
Something simple. A bottle and a straw.
Wow! Contains Fallout, the exclusive, patented ingredient.
You were my idol. I regarded you as a big man, but you're not a big man. You're just a little... poop of a man. And that's the way the poop poops.
Watch out! He's probably on his fourth tranquilizer by now.

[watching reporters swarm a movie star]
What's Rita saying?... Turn on the TV.
Which station?
Any station! It's like when the president speaks.
I picked him up, I can pick him down.
I'm not a failure. I'm the largest success there is. I'm an average guy. And all us average guys are successes. We run the works! Not the big guy behind the big desk!
Don't leave me out, I have to be important in my own incorporated.
How can I remember? I'm all excited because you're loving me up!
